articles.title: Philip Rivers’ Hall of Fame candidacy will reset if he signs to the active roster - NBC Sports
articles.description: Rivers is among 26 semifinalists for the Hall of Fame but is working out for the Colts on Tuesday.

articles.description: The Mets should be pleased that two of baseball’s best boppers remain on the board. However, it’s also a near necessity they come away with one of the two.

articles.title: NFL, NFLPA issue joint statement regarding Tee Higgins’ latest concussion - NBC Sports

articles.title: Notre Dame’s Love, Indiana’s Mendoza, Vanderbilt’s Pavia, Ohio State’s Sayin are named Heisman finalists - NBC News
articles.description: Notre Dame running back Jeremiyah Love, Indiana quarterback Fernando Mendoza, Vanderbilt quarterback Diego Pavia and Ohio State quarterback Julian Sayin are the finalists for the Heisman Trophy for the top player in college football.

articles.title: Chargers' Herbert set for MNF after hand surgery - ESPN
articles.description: Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert, who had surgery a week ago on his fractured left hand, is active for Monday night's game against the Eagles.

articles.title: Riley Leonard has a knee issue that puts his availability in question - NBC Sports
articles.description: The Colts have Anthony Richardson on injured reserve and will have Daniel Jones on injured reserve later this week.

articles.title: Jeff Kent elected to baseball Hall of Fame, which again keeps doors shut for Bonds and Clemens - AP News
articles.description: Jeff Kent has been elected to baseball’s Hall of Fame by the contemporary era committee, while steroids-tainted stars Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens were among seven players who fell short once again. Kent appeared on 14 of 16 ballots, two more than the 12 bal…

articles.title: Raheem Morris says it would be "selfish" to think about his job security - NBC Sports
articles.description: The Falcons fell to 4-9 with Sunday's blowout loss to the Seahawks, so it isn't a great surprise that Morris' job security came up during his Monday press conference.

articles.title: Report: Trey Hendrickson to have core muscle surgery - NBC Sports
articles.description: Bengals defensive end Trey Hendrickson has not played since Week 8 and a report on Monday indicates that he will not play again this season.

articles.title: What to look for in the next four weeks (if you're a fan, not a player) - Panthers.com
articles.description: The Panthers are going into the final four weeks of the regular season tied for first in the NFC South. Which means, there's a lot to play for. And it starts this week with the Saints.
